intro: Zaluzianskya microsiphon, commonly known as the narrow-leaved zonal plant, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its compact, evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces clusters of white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Zaluzianskya microsiphon is also valued for its drought tolerance and ability to attract pollinators.
